study.title: Assessment of Bacterial Profiles and Antimicrobial Susceptibility Pattern of Isolates Among Patients Diagnosed with Surgical Site Infections at Mizan-Tepi University Teaching Hospital, Southwest Ethiopia: A Prospective Observational Cohort Study

design.inclusion_criteria_text: All patients who underwent a surgical procedure at Mizan-Tepi university teaching hospital during the study period were included. Follow-up for 30 days post-procedure for SSI.
design.exclusion_criteria_text: Patients who developed postoperative wound infections later than 30 days, patients with infected burn wounds, and those with an initial diagnosis suggestive of infection were excluded.

country_specific_sites: Mizan-Tepi University Teaching Hospital, Mizan-Aman, Southwest Ethiopia

eligibility.population: All patients undergoing surgical procedures at Mizan-Tepi University Teaching Hospital during June–September 2021.
eligibility.intervention: Antibiotic prophylaxis (ceftriaxone alone or with metronidazole, ampicillin)

populations.description: All patients undergoing surgical procedures during study period
populations.comorbidities_key: Anemia 3.1%, cardiac disorder 2.3%, diabetes 1.9%, respiratory disease 1.5%, malignancy 1.5%, HIV/AIDS 1.5%

provenance.section_heading: Socio-Demographic Characteristics and Magnitude of SSIs
provenance.text_snippet: In this study, a total of 262 patients underwent surgical procedures, all of whom were followed up during the study.

definitions.resistance_definition_text: Multidrug-resistance (MDR) is considered as resistance to three or more classes of antibiotics.
definitions.outcome_definitions_text: SSI defined per CDC-NHSN and WHO criteria; MDR defined as resistance to ≥3 antibiotic classes.

lab_methods.specimen_collection_method: Aseptic collection of two wound swabs from at least 1 cm2 area of viable wound tissue before cleaning with antiseptic.
lab_methods.culture_method: Swabs cultured onto MacConkey and mannitol salt agar; incubated 24–48h at 35–37°C; identification by Gram stain, colony characteristics, catalase/oxidase, biochemical tests.
lab_methods.QC_measures: Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 and Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 used as quality control strains.
lab_methods.organism_identification_method: Manual (Gram stain, colony characteristics, biochemical tests)
lab_methods.contamination_handling: Wound base irrigated with saline to avoid skin flora contamination; aseptic technique throughout.
lab_methods.lab_capacity_notes: No blood agar used; no molecular techniques performed due to resource limitations.

codes.summary: The study found a high SSI rate of 12.6% among surgical patients, with higher rates in specific subgroups.

evidence_quotes.quote: In this study, a total of 262 patients underwent surgical procedures, all of whom were followed up during the study. Of these, 33/262 (12.6%) developed SSIs within 30 days of the procedure.

codes.subtheme: resistance patterns and rates by pathogen/antibiotic
codes.summary: All Gram-negative isolates were resistant to ampicillin, and high rates of multidrug resistance were observed among both Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria.

evidence_quotes.quote: All (100.0%) Gram-negative isolates showed resistance toward ampicillin, and 91.7% of isolates were resistant toward amoxicillin-clavulanic acid.
Multidrug-resistance (MDR) towards three or more classes of antibiotics was 100.0%.

provenance.section_heading: Antimicrobial Resistance Profiles
provenance.text_snippet: All (100.0%) Gram-negative isolates showed resistance toward ampicillin, and 91.7% of isolates were resistant toward amoxicillin-clavulanic acid.

codes.subtheme: inappropriate use, IPC gaps, diagnostics delays, policy failures, supply chain, workforce, patient factors
codes.summary: High resistance rates may be related to frequent and inappropriate use of antibiotics for therapeutic and prophylactic purposes.

evidence_quotes.quote: This significantly higher resistance may be related to the frequent and inappropriate use of these antibiotics for therapeutic and prophylactic purposes in human infections.

provenance.section_heading: Discussion
provenance.text_snippet: This significantly higher resistance may be related to the frequent and inappropriate use of these antibiotics for therapeutic and prophylactic purposes in human infections.

codes.summary: Periodic surveillance of bacterial profiles and antibiotic susceptibility testing, coupled with strict protocols for antibiotic administration and operative room regulations, is recommended.

evidence_quotes.quote: Therefore, periodic surveillance of the bacterial profile and antibiotic susceptibility testing coupled with the implementation of a strict protocol for antibiotic administration and operative room regulations is important to minimize the burden of SSIs with resistant bacteria pathogens.

provenance.section_heading: Conclusion
provenance.text_snippet: Therefore, periodic surveillance of the bacterial profile and antibiotic susceptibility testing coupled with the implementation of a strict protocol for antibiotic administration and operative room regulations is important to minimize the burden of SSIs with resistant bacteria pathogens.

codes.summary: The study did not use blood agar or molecular techniques, limiting detection of some pathogens and resistance genes.

evidence_quotes.quote: In this study, blood agar medium was not used to detect SSI-causing pathogens, which could undermine the prevalence and types of isolated bacteria. Due to resource issues, molecular techniques to provide more information to indicate specific antibiotic resistance genes have not been performed.

provenance.section_heading: Limitations of This Study
provenance.text_snippet: In this study, blood agar medium was not used to detect SSI-causing pathogens, which could undermine the prevalence and types of isolated bacteria. Due to resource issues, molecular techniques to provide more information to indicate specific antibiotic resistance genes have not been performed.
